column4: I have a problem with a sata drive formatted in ntfs. The drive was sdf1 and is in fstab like that. Then for some reason I rebooted and it changed to sdb1 and want mount. Anyone have any idea here?
I have a problem with a sata drive formatted in ntfs. The drive was sdf1 and is in fstab like that. Then for some reason I rebooted and it changed to sdb1 and wont mount. Anyone have any idea here?
i just changed to sdb1? you didn't change anything?.. why not just change the fstab entry to match the new device name?
I am changing the fstab now, 1sec
it usually doesn't change on it's own.. usually it's because you moved around some SATA connections or replaced hard drives or something
all i did was reboot the pc
no change internally at all
then it shouldn't change.. but we'll blame it on the computer troll as usual =)
lol yea no idea why it did that, guess i will just not reboot anymore
how can i find the uuid?
sudo blkid is one way
didnt do anything lol
nothing? running "sudo blkid" in a terminal didn't give you any output at all?
no output
sudo vol_id -u device gave me a # tho
blkid might just give you already mounted filesystems.. not sure though
but I guess any way to find out the uuid is fine
yes
yea either works, thanks
or rather.. UUID=XXXXXXX
ah great
unop: great you guys, that mounted and all, thanks for all your help
you're welcome
